question: The radiations used in Radiotherapy for the treatment of Cancer destroys the Cancer tumour mainly by which among the following?
option1: Destroying the Cytoplasm of the Cancerous Cells
option2: Destroying the Cell membranes of the Cancerous Cells
option3: Destroying the DNA of the Cancerous Cells
option4: Destroying the spindle fibres which are used in Cell Division
answer: Destroying the DNA of the Cancerous Cells
explanation: The radiations used in Radiotherapy for the treatment of Cancer destroys the Cancer tumour mainly by Destroying the DNA of the Cancerous Cells. It uses high doses of radiation to kill cancer cells and shrink tumors.
